metadata.rty_Description: Formulation of a work in human language, whose literary form and style can be detected and whose creation can be attributed to one or more individuals.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Overall form of the literary style (verse, prose, mixed).
fields.trm_Description: Literary form of the creative work.

vocabTerms.label: unknown
vocabTerms.description: The form is unknown because all manifestations (Witnesses) of the text are lost and there is no hypothesis about whether the text is in verse, prose, or both.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Whether it is received as fact that the entity existed (No, is not hypothetical) or it is attested in a hypothesis (Yes, is hypothetical).

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Specific literary genre or subgenre attributed to the text.

If in verse, the number of verses.
For prose, the number of chapters.

Type of verses
fields.trm_Description: When a text is composed in verse, the poetic meter.

vocabTerms.label: octosyllabe
vocabTerms.description: Line consisting of 8 syllables.

vocabTerms.label: decasyllabe
vocabTerms.description: Line consisting of 10 syllables.

vocabTerms.label: alexandrine
vocabTerms.description: Line consisting of 2 half-lines each of 6 syllables, total of 12 syllables. Also known as French alexandrine.

vocabTerms.label: hexasyllabe
vocabTerms.description: Line consisting of 6 syllables.

vocabTerms.label: dodecasyllabe
vocabTerms.description: Line consisting of 12 syllables.

vocabTerms.label: pentasyllabe
vocabTerms.description: Line consisting of 5 syllables.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Rhyme or assonance
fields.trm_Description: When a text is composed in verse, the rhyme pattern.

vocabTerms.label: unknown
vocabTerms.description: It is known that the text is in verse and rhyming, but the type of rhyme is unknown.

vocabTerms.label: assonance
vocabTerms.description: Rhyme is allowed between words that have a repeated vowel sound, such as ‚Äúa‚Äù in ‚ÄúVio puertas abiertas e u√ßos sin ca√±ados / alcandaras vazias sin pielles e sin mantos‚Äù in Castilian. (J. Gornall, ‚ÄúAssonance in the Hispanic \"Romance,\" 1995)

vocabTerms.label: monorhyme
vocabTerms.description: All lines have the same end-rhyme.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Prior text(s) that the entity reworked as an adaptation, translation, versification, etc.

vocabTerms.label: fragmentary
vocabTerms.description: Surviving in only fragments. No complete witnesses survive.

vocabTerms.label: lost
vocabTerms.description: No witnesses of this text survive. It is a completely lost tradition.

vocabTerms.label: surviving
vocabTerms.description: Surviving in at least one (more or less) complete manuscript

metadata.rty_Description: An abstract \'work\', as an entity of superior level to  a given text. Typically, it can be a \'geste\' known by several major versions or independent texts, like the Story of Guillaume or Vivien, or Perceval for that matter.

vocabTerms.label: England
vocabTerms.description: Ancestral and popular histories taking place in England, including English folklore.

vocabTerms.label: Britain
vocabTerms.description: Stories about King Arthur and other legendary kings in Britain and Brittany.

vocabTerms.label: France
vocabTerms.description: Tales about Charlemagne and other legendary stories related to the history of France.

vocabTerms.label: Rome
vocabTerms.description: Histories about antiquity, ancient Greek and Roman mythology, as well as the conquests of Alexander the Great and Julius Caesar.

metadata.rty_Description: a witness of a text, placed in a stemma or otherwise

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: The text of which this item is a physical embodiment and inscription.

A subdivision of the witness\'s text in an extant document.
div
The document in which the witness was last observed.
Whether the entity is attested (True) in a hypothesis or whether it is received as fact that it exists or existed (False).

vocabTerms.label: unknown
vocabTerms.description: The information is not ready to be input.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText:
[Temporary]
Brief note about the hypothesis that attests to this record\'s existence. This information is meant to be a temporary note that will eventually be entered into a Hypothesis entity, which should be linked back to this record.

If the witness is a fragment, another fragment that represents an earlier part of the text and the 2 fragments were originally produced as one 1 unit.
[linked fragment (pp.1-2)] <--(used to follow)-- [this fragment (pp.3-4)]

If the witness was originally with another witness, especially the witness of a different text, in a now lost document, the witness that immediately preceded it in the hypothetical document.
[linked witness] <--(used to follow)-- [this witness]

An abbreviation, usually a letter or a letter with a numeral, assigned to a source. If not siglum has been associated with the witness, use a shelfmark or other shorthand that would serve the purpose of labeling the witness in a stemma.
Other sigla by which the witness is known and which is different than the siglum preferred for making new stemma.
Survival status of the witness.
fields.trm_Description: The survival status of a Witness.

vocabTerms.label: fragmentary
vocabTerms.description: Only 1 or 2 pages are all that remain of the witness, which is expected to be much longer.

vocabTerms.label: complete
vocabTerms.description: All of the literary content (not including dedication, etc.) is extant and legible.

vocabTerms.label: defective
vocabTerms.description: Some pages containing literary content are missing from the extant witness, but the majority or a significant portion survives.

vocabTerms.label: lost
vocabTerms.description: In the case of a hypothetical witness, whose existence is posited, no part of the witness survives.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Brief note detailing the entity\'s survival status.
The witness was never a full manifestation of the text, but offers an excerpt or a citation of the text.

vocabTerms.label: unknown
vocabTerms.description: The information is not ready to be input.

Order of the text subdivision within the witness. Start counting at 1. If the witness is not subdivided, enter 1.
Property P1545
To be compared with the \"verse length\" of the representative text, the number of verses or lines from the text represented on this part of the witness.
A simple description of the portion of the text, i.e. \"first third,\" represented on this part of the witness.
If the witness is composed of multiple volumes, the integer, roman numeral, or other indicator used by archival or library catalogues to identify the part as a volume of the witness.
Description of the support, decorations, layout, and script type.
The length of the text as calculated by the number of lines.
If the text is in verse, a categorical description of how many verses the scribe fit into a line of text.
Whether the text lines have been interrupted, i.e. cut (Yes, incomplete).

vocabTerms.label: unknown
vocabTerms.description: The information is not ready for input.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText:
A formatted string that represents the numbering on the beginning and end of an uninterrupted series of pages.
When a range of pages, separate the two numbers with a hyphen, i.e. \"1r-4v\".
When a single page, do not include separator, i.e. \"1r\".
Status of record\'s preparation for public view.
fields.trm_Description: Terms about records\' quality check / review status.

vocabTerms.label: Action required
vocabTerms.description: The record contains information that requires a review.

vocabTerms.label: Open
vocabTerms.description: The record is newly created and/or in process.

vocabTerms.label: Publish
vocabTerms.description: The record has been approved for publication. It\'s accuracy has been verified.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Information to help with review of this entity.

metadata.rty_Description: Digital document visually representing a physical document or archival item.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Unique Resource Identifier (aka URL) for the digital document, which must contain a series of digital images.
Document.
If encoded according to IIIF standards, a URI linking to the file of a IIIF manifest.
Archival Resource Key for the item or notice in the archival institution\'s catalogue / system.

metadata.rty_Description: A range of images from a digitization, which correspond to a discrete, uninterrupted series of pages or leafs of a part of a document.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: The portion (pages) of the document represented in the digitized images.
The digital object, which has a URL, from which this discrete range of images comes.

A formatted string that represents the index of the first and last image file in the series of images.
When multiple files, separate the first and last with two colons, i.e. \"4::725\".
When a single file, do not include the separator, i.e. \"725\".

A formatted string that represents the numbering at the start and end of the corresponding series of pages.
When a range of pages, separate the two numbers with two colons, i.e. \"1r::4v\".
When a single page, do not include separator, i.e. \"1r\".

metadata.rty_Description: Annotation connecting an item to an external source of information / reference, including page numbers and/or quoted text.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText:
Source in which the information is stated.
P248

Page number(s) of the source in which the information is stated.
P304
Prefix or other key used in a dictionary or encyclopedia to refer to an entry, i.e. \"AnsMetz.\"
Quotation from the source of information.

metadata.rty_Description: Physical description of a witness\'s material support.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: The document that is the subject of the physical description.
Description of the material of which the object is composed.
fields.trm_Description: Material of which an object is composed.

vocabTerms.label: perg
vocabTerms.description: Parchment and vellum

vocabTerms.label: chart
vocabTerms.description: All kinds of paper

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText:
\"[T]he form of the object in its original state, before any mutilation, rebinding, etc.\"
Consolidated TEI Schema objectDesc[@form])
fields.trm_Description:
\"[T]he form of the object in its original state, before any mutilation, rebinding, etc.\"
Consolidated TEI Schema

vocabTerms.label: codex
vocabTerms.description:
\"multiple gatherings of leaves, held within a binding of some kind, and used by turning the leaves.\"
Consolidated TEI Schema

vocabTerms.label: roll
vocabTerms.description:
\"a parchment membrane, or two or more such membranes, either sewn together edge-to-edge to form a continuous surface for writing, or laid together in a pile and sewn together at the head, and used by unrolling the membranes.\"
Consolidated TEI Schema

vocabTerms.label: sheet
vocabTerms.description:
\"a single sheet of parchment paper, not intended to form part of a codex, either kept flat or folded (rather than rolled) for storage.\"
Consolidated TEI Schema

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText:
The current width of the folio size in millimeters.
If unknown, enter \"NA\"

The current height of the folio size in millimeters.
If unknown, enter \"NA\"

An in-line citation (or URL of a library finding aid) documenting where the measurements were described.
If the measurements are unknown, enter \"NA\"
The height in millimeters (a range is permitted) of the folio size in the witness as it would have been before any mutilation, rebinding, etc.
The width in millimeters (a range is permitted) of the folio size in the witness as it would have been before any mutilation, rebinding, etc.
An in-line citation (or URL of a library finding aid) documenting where the measurements were described.
Decorations that are unrelated to the text. They include decorated letters (initials), rubrication, and pictures that do not illustrate scenes connected to the accompanying text.

vocabTerms.label: unknown
vocabTerms.description: At the time of data entry, it is unknown whether or not the document contains any decoration.

vocabTerms.label: initial
vocabTerms.description:
\"Letter at the beginning of a chapter or paragraph that is larger than the rest of the text.\"
Property Q378408
Equivalent to Initial in HMML School Lexicon.

vocabTerms.label: rubrication
vocabTerms.description:
\"Red letters added for emphasis in a manuscript.\"
Property Q1365156
Equivalent to Rubrication in HMML School Lexicon.

vocabTerms.label: incomplete dec.
vocabTerms.description: There is evidence that rubrication or one or more illustrations or initials were planned to be included on pages but were not realized.

vocabTerms.label: no decoration
vocabTerms.description: The document does not contain any decoration.

vocabTerms.label: unrelated pictures
vocabTerms.description: Pictorial elements that do not have any illustrative, narrative connection to the text, including miniatures, borders, bas-de-page scenes, and marginalia.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Decorations that are related to the text, which illustrate a scene in the story. Select the category that matches the number most specialists agree are present and completed.

Height in millimeters (a range is permitted) of the writing area.
Equivalent to dimensions[@type=\"written\"]/height

Width in millimeters (a range is permitted) of the writing area.
Equivalent to dimensions[@type=\"written\"]/width
An in-line citation for the source of the information about the dimensions of the witness\'s writing area.
An estimation of the number of columns in the writing area, equivalent to the @columns attribute of layout in TEI.
An estimation of the number of lines of text per page or per column, equivalent to the @writtenLines attribute of layout in TEI.
The text starts above the top ruled line on the page. If no, then the text starts at the line below the top line.

vocabTerms.label: unknown
vocabTerms.description: The information is not ready for input.

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: Principal script type of the witness.

vocabTerms.label: praegothica
vocabTerms.description: protogothic

fields.rst_DisplayHelpText: More refined definition of the main script type.
